page.title: 03ENVIRONMENT AND ECOLOGY
page.content:
This area is rural with large areas of unspoilt countryside, particularly on the hills where farming is difficult. There are many footpaths, some of which require attention as they have become overgrown in recent years. There are also many small streams running through the area, which support a variety of wildlife. Both the flora and fauna of the area are worthy of study.
Within the villages, there is a certain amount of concern over heavy traffic and vehicles of all types travelling at too great a speed for safety. Another cause for complaint is the smells from farms and poultry units. Generally, however, the local residents regard it as a healthy and peaceful place to live.
